definition: Pekingese/Pekinese
lion
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: Japan's new government Poodle or Pekinese?
sentences.chinese: 日本新政府到底是獅子狗還是京巴？

sentences.english: The Poodle, the Pom, the Alsatian.
sentences.chinese: 獅子狗，博美狗，阿爾薩斯。

sentences.english: I don't want my picture taken walking in the park with her poodle.
sentences.chinese: 我不想被拍到在公園和她的獅子狗在散步。

sentences.english: The only animals you see in the streets are pet pekinese .
sentences.chinese: 路上唯一看得見的動物是寵物獅子狗。

sentences.english: The Poodle and the Shih Tzu completed the top 10.
sentences.chinese: 同時躋身前十名的還有獅子狗和西施犬。

sentences.english: And we're all over that farm, this little poodle and me.
sentences.chinese: 我們在農場，小獅子狗和我。

sentences.english: When I took the Shih-Tzu out, the Collie jumped and scratched at the door.
sentences.chinese: 我牽出獅子狗的時候，長毛牧羊犬跳起來狠狠地抓門。
